definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: The guns belched at the enemy.

sentences.chinese: 这种新枪炮都加有来复线。

sentences.english: Reports from gunnery officers were more enthusiastic than those of Fighter Command.
sentences.chinese: 来自枪炮长的报告要比战斗机飞行员的热情的多。

sentences.english: The sale is noted in the gunsmith's log-book .
sentences.chinese: 这笔买卖已记录在枪炮制造人的日志里了。

sentences.english: The firing petered out yesterday evening.
sentences.chinese: 枪炮声昨天傍晚逐渐停了。

sentences.english: Guns were firing， and shells and bullets were flying about everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 枪炮轰鸣，炮弹和子弹到处乱飞。

sentences.english: They heard the guns blasting away all night.
sentences.chinese: 他们听见枪炮整夜连续轰击。

sentences.english: The traditionally loud voice of the gunnery branch continued to dominate the debate.
sentences.chinese: 枪炮专业的声音仍然叫得很响，继续统治着争论。

sentences.english: Then firing continued for another hour , and I moved quietly through the trees to the shore .
sentences.chinese: 枪炮声持续了一个小时，我悄悄来到岸边的树丛中。

sentences.english: The battlefield was bristled with guns.
The formation of secondary muzzle flash is closely related to reducing gases in combustion products.
sentences.chinese: 枪炮二次焰的形成与燃烧产物中还原性气体息息相关。

sentences.english: They were enrolled in the royal guard as gunners.
sentences.chinese: 他们被招募到宫廷卫队当枪炮手。

sentences.english: There were explosions and gunfire throughout Friday.
sentences.chinese: 周五一整天，阿比让都弥漫着爆炸声和枪炮声。

definition: big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
firearms (in historical context)/flintlock (old powder and shot firearm)
